channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Biden Issues Order Allowing Temporary Border Closure to Migrants
item.description: The move shows how drastically immigration politics have shifted in the United States. The American Civil Liberties Union said it planned to challenge the order in court.

item.title: Middle East Crisis: Biden Suggests Netanyahu Is Prolonging War to Stay in Power
item.description: Asked if the Israeli prime minister was prolonging the war in Gaza to hold on to office, the president said that he believes “there is every reason for people to draw that conclusion,” echoing something many of his aides have been saying privately.

item.title: Young voters’ top concern isn’t abortion—they care more about finding an affordable place to live, a new survey shows
item.description: The cost of starter homes has risen twice as fast as incomes, a Redfin economist said.

item.title: OpenAI Whistleblowers Describe Reckless and Secretive Culture
item.description: A group of current and former employees is calling for sweeping changes to the artificial intelligence industry, including greater transparency and protections for whistle-blowers.

item.title: Modi Claims 3rd Term in India, but His Party Suffers Losses
item.description: Early election results indicated that the coalition of Prime Minister Narendra Modi, India’s most powerful leader in generations, would win a narrower majority in Parliament.

item.title: Boeing CEO warns against protectionism as US, UK gear up for elections
item.description: Boeing is working to restart plane deliveries to China.

item.title: Student Protesters Want Charges Dropped as Universities Grapple With Discipline
item.description: At pro-Palestinian demonstrations, students have broken codes of conduct and, sometimes, the law. But the question of whether and how to discipline them is vexing universities.

item.title: Some Gazans Call on Hamas to Accept Cease-Fire Proposal, but Remain Skeptical
item.description: After months of bombardment, many in Gaza believe Hamas should make any compromise necessary to end the war.

item.title: AI isn’t yet capable of snapping up jobs—except in these 4 industries, McKinsey says
item.description: New tech won’t eliminate work for most employees, but certain industries are in real peril.

item.title: San Diego Is Once Again a Top Migrant Entry Point
item.description: Asylum seekers from around the world are trying to enter the United States through California, and immigrant traffic there has reached its highest level in decades.

item.title: Modi No Longer Appears All-Powerful Despite Securing a Third Term
item.description: While Narendra Modi appeared to secure a third term as India’s leader, the election was closer than expected, forcing him to rely on coalition partners that don’t share his Hindu nationalist agenda.

item.title: It’s an employer’s market now as U.S. job openings topple to lowest level in 3 years
item.description: Available jobs decreased from 8.36 million in March to 8.06 million in April, according to the Bureau of Labor Statistics.

item.title: Join ‘The Daily’ Podcast at the Tribeca Festival
item.description: The show’s hosts, Michael Barbaro and Sabrina Tavernise, share how the podcast gets made in a special event on June 9 in New York City.

item.title: India’s Next Government Will Face Serious Climate Challenges
item.description: Farmers have repeatedly protested over grievances tied to global warming, a major political and economic test given the importance of India’s rural economy.

item.title: The master multitaskers: what do realtors really do?
item.description: Realtors and real estate agents alike are focused on finding and serving clients.
